org.jamsim.ascape

Class MicroSimScape<D extends ScapeData>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Scape
      • org.jamsim.ascape.MicroSimScape<D>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - a scape data class that defines data external to the scape for use by agents, and for loading agents.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class MicroSimScape<D extends ScapeData>
extends Scape
implements java.util.Observer
    A Scape with micro-simulation input/output functions including base file loading, and output tables and external / global data tables that appear in the Ascape Navigator.
    Version:
    $Revision$
    Author:
    Oliver Mannion

    • Constructor Detail

      • MicroSimScape

        public MicroSimScape(CollectionSpace space,
             java.lang.String name,
             Agent prototypeAgent,
             FileLoader loader)
        Creates a MicroSimScape and loads its agents from a base file. The location of the base file is stored in Preferences. If such a location does not exist, then the user is prompted for the base file location.
        Parameters:
        space - scape space
        name - name of the scape. This will be the name of the dataframe if & when created in R.
        prototypeAgent - the prototype agent so the navigator knows to show fields that have getter/setter methods.
        loader - file loader object which provides preferences, an select file dialog, and output services

      • createScape

        public void createScape()
        Set the Navigator Tree Builder here. At this point the SwingEnvironment exists. We can't do this in createGraphicViews() because at that point the navigator has already been built (see the order of scape creation etc. in org.ascape.runtime.swing.SwingRunner#openImplementation(String[], boolean) . This method also overrides the scape implementation which removes all agents and replaces them with clones with parameter values of 0.

      • createGraphicViews

        public void createGraphicViews()

      • addOutputDataset

        public void addOutputDataset(OutputDatasetProvider provider,
                    java.lang.String nodeGroupName)
        Add a OutputDatasetProvider which provides nodes at the end of runs/simulation under a particular node group under the output tables node.
        Parameters:
        provider - provider
        nodeGroupName - node group name or null if this dataset will appear under outputTablesNode

      • setWeightCalculator

        public void setWeightCalculator(WeightCalculator wcalc)
                         throws InvalidDataException
        Set-up observers (all agents and the root scape) to register changes when the WeightCalculator changes, then calls notify on the weight calculator.
        Parameters:
        wcalc - weight calculator
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - if wcalc can't be validated

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
          java.lang.Object arg)
        Called after weights have changed (and after all children have been reweighted). Here we update the scape dataframe in R.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer

      • getBasefile

        public java.lang.String getBasefile()
        Expose base file as model parameter to Ascape.
        Returns:
        base file

      • loadAgents

        public void loadAgents(D scapeData)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Loads this scape with agents from a base file. The location of the base file is stored in Preferences. If such a location does not exist, then the user is prompted for the base file location. The method must be called after construction and after the scape has been added to its parent, so that the scape variable is available.
        Parameters:
        scapeData - provides method to load agents. Also used by agents during their initialisation to obtain globals.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if problem loading the agents

      • setBasefile

        public void setBasefile(java.lang.String bfileName)
        Change the base file to the specified file after agents have already been loaded. If the base file doesn't exist, then a file chooser dialog is displayed to allow the user to select. If specified or selected, any existing agents are removed and the base file is loaded. This method is used when setting the base file variable from the model parameters.
        Parameters:
        bfileName - base file to load

      • getOutputDirectory

        public final java.lang.String getOutputDirectory()
        Get the scape's output directory. Used for result output to files.
        Returns:
        output directory

      • getDataSetOfAgents

        public CDataCacheContainer getDataSetOfAgents()
                                       throws CDataGridException
        Return the agents of this scape as a caper dataset.
        Returns:
        casper dataset of this scape's agents.
        Throws:
        CDataGridException - if problem creating dataset

      • loadR

        public ScapeRInterface loadR(java.lang.String dataFrameSymbol,
                    boolean keepAllRunDFs)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Add R to this scape, create a dataframe in R from the scape, and create data dictionary named "dict" in R. Agents and ScapeData must have already been created via a call to loadAgents(ScapeData) prior to calling this.
        Parameters:
        dataFrameSymbol - replacement symbol. When evaluating rRunEndCommand and commands during the creation of output datasets in ROutput and ROutput1DMultiRun, this symbol is searched for and replaced with the current run's dataframe name.
        keepAllRunDFs - flag to keep the dataframes from each run in R. This means creating each new dataframe with a unique name.
        Returns:
        scape R interface
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if problem looking up startUpFilePrefsKey or initialising R

      • addChart

        public void addChart(ChartProvider source)
        Add a chart to the scape. Adds the chart as a listener and also creates a node in the navigator for the chart.
        Parameters:
        source - a chart provider
